message.content:
Below is one way to “read off” the temple‐like structure from the two images and match it to the block dictionary:

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  Description of the Target Structure
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Blocks & Layers  
  - Eleven pieces in all.  
  - Arranged in three main tiers:  
    (a) A single yellow rectangular base on the bottom.  
    (b) Four vertical orange “column” blocks on top of that base, capped by two yellow rectangular “beams” spanning front and back.  
    (c) Above the beams, a red arch block in the center, surmounted by a red “rectangular” block, and finally two orange wedge blocks forming the pitched roof.  

• Spatial Layout  
  - Bottom Layer: One yellow rectangular prism lying flat (the “floor”).  
  - Middle Layer: Four orange cylinders stand on the base corners. Two yellow rectangular prisms lie across the tops of the front and back columns (i.e., one beam across the front pair of columns, another across the rear pair).  
  - Top Layer:  
    • A red arch block sits in the middle (centered between the beams).  
    • Another red block (identical arch‐shaped piece but oriented so it looks rectangular from the front) rests on top of the arch.  
    • Two orange wedges, mirrored left/right, form the roof peak.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  Selecting the Required Blocks from the Dictionary
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Yellow Rectangles:  
  - Use block #6 (the short, flat, yellow prism) for all horizontal rectangular pieces.  
    – 1× for the base at the bottom.  
    – 2× more for the spanning beams on top of the columns.  

• Orange Cylinders:  
  - Use block #10 (vertical orange cylinder) for the four columns.  

• Red Arch Blocks:  
  - Use block #1 for the visible arch (its arch runs front‐to‐back).  
  - Use block #5 for the “red rectangular” piece above the arch (same shape, arch oriented sideways so it appears rectangular from the front).  

• Orange Roof Wedges:  
  - Use block #13 and block #15 as the left‐ and right‐slope roof pieces (they mirror one another without requiring rotation).  

Hence the indices needed are:  
•  #6   (used 3 times)  
•  #10  (used 4 times)  
•  #1   (used 1 time)  
•  #5   (used 1 time)  
•  #13  (used 1 time)  
•  #15  (used 1 time)  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  Step‐by‐Step Assembly Order
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{  
  Step1:  Move block with index 6   // place yellow base  
  Step2:  Move block with index 10  // first column  
  Step3:  Move block with index 10  // second column  
  Step4:  Move block with index 10  // third column  
  Step5:  Move block with index 10  // fourth column  
  Step6:  Move block with index 6   // yellow beam across front columns  
  Step7:  Move block with index 6   // yellow beam across rear columns  
  Step8:  Move block with index 1   // red arch on top  
  Step9:  Move block with index 5   // red “rectangular” block above arch  
  Step10: Move block with index 13  // left roof wedge  
  Step11: Move block with index 15  // right roof wedge  
}
